title: A rocket is continuously firing its engines as it

content.question: A rocket is continuously firing its engines as it accelerates away from Earth. For the first kilometer of its ascent, the mass of fuel ejected is small compared to the mass of the rocket. For this distance, which of the following indicates the changes, if any, in the kinetic energy of the rocket, the gravitational potential energy of the Earth-rocket system, and the mechanical energy of the Earth-rocket system?

choices.label: Rocket Kinetic EnergySystem Gravitational Potential EnergySystem Mechanical EnergyIncreasingIncreasingIncreasing
Rocket Kinetic EnergySystem Gravitational Potential EnergySystem Mechanical EnergyIncreasingIncreasingConstant
Rocket Kinetic Energy System Gravitational Potential Energy System Mechanical Energy Increasing Decreasing Decreasing
Rocket Kinetic Energy System Gravitational Potential Energy System Mechanical Energy Decreasing Increasing Constant

content.answer: Rocket Kinetic EnergySystem Gravitational Potential EnergySystem Mechanical EnergyIncreasingIncreasingIncreasing

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
